name: The Citizens Foundation USA
mission:
The Citizens Foundation, USA (TCF-USA) is a professionally managed tax-exempt charity, with a support network of volunteer chapters across the USA. We support the building of civil society in Pakistan by providing quality education to underprivileged children, promoting gender equality & partnering for reform of public education. We believe that education is a basic human right. Universal access to education is a prerequisite for democratic institutions to flourish in Pakistan and for its people to compete in a global economy.
TCF currently has 1,833 schools in all the provinces of Pakistan with 280,000 children enrolled, nearly half of them girls. TCF has trained and employed 13,000 women as teachers and principals, making it the largest employer of women in the private sector.
TCF also provides scholarships for tertiary education to the deserving graduates of its' secondary schools and an adult literacy program that has transformed the lives of women.
theoryOfChange: TCF believes that providing quality education through purpose-built schools and all-female faculty in the heart of needy communities creates agents of positive change (alumni) who uplift their entire community.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.tcfusa.org/zakat (Source: https://www.tcfusa.org/zakat)

The charity provides operational support for schools, builds new school units, and offers higher education scholarships.
Programs include converting schools to solar power and providing higher education scholarships.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a high overall score due to its exceptional financial transparency, efficient use of donor funds, and direct impact on global education urgency.
areas_for_improvement: Working capital reserves are currently at 4.7 months, which is below the common non-profit benchmark of 6-12 months for long-term sustainability.

dimension_explanations.alignment: There is a high alignment for donors interested in global education and Islamic giving, as the organization is Zakat-eligible and addresses a critical cause urgency [2][8]. Its long track record of building school units and providing higher education scholarships establishes it as a reliable partner for philanthropic goals [4][6].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates high impact through the direct provision of education, maintaining a cost per beneficiary of approximately $55.37 [1][4]. With a program expense ratio of 89.5%, it efficiently manages a total revenue of $18,303,365 to fund school operations, construction, and solar energy conversions [3][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Citizens Foundation USA empowers underprivileged children in Pakistan through high-quality education and sustainable school infrastructure.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 89.5% ensures the vast majority of funds directly support educational initiatives.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.10 per $1 raised.
Strong financial health and accountability reflected in a Charity Navigator score of 99.33333333333333/100.
baseline_narrative.summary: The Citizens Foundation USA supports the development of civil society in Pakistan by providing quality education to marginalized youth through school construction and operational support [4][7]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting educational equity [2].

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="5">99.99.33333333333333/100 from Charity Navigator score</cite>, a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid, and a robust governance structure featuring a <cite id="10">15-member board</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could publish more detailed independent impact evaluations of its long-term alumni outcomes.

impact.explanation: Operations show an outstanding <cite id="3">89.5% program expense ratio</cite> and a highly efficient delivery model with a cost of just <cite id="11">$55.37 per beneficiary</cite>.

rich_narrative.headline: The Citizens Foundation USA empowers underprivileged children in Pakistan through high-quality education and sustainable school infrastructure.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fulfill their zakat obligations by investing in high-efficiency, large-scale educational infrastructure and scholarships for underprivileged children in Pakistan.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations with confidence
Prioritize extremely high financial efficiency and low overhead
Care deeply about educational equity and poverty alleviation in Pakistan
Value established organizations with a long track record
giving_considerations: Large-scale operations mean individual gifts join a pooled fund for systemic impact
Focus is strictly on Pakistan, not a global multi-country approach
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking hyperlocal US community impact or those looking to fund emergency humanitarian relief in active conflict zones.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks multiple outcome metrics via Candid and demonstrates verified evidence of impact, including specific counts of schools built and scholarships awarded.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: TCF seeks to make the children of Pakistan into upstanding citizens by removing barriers of class and privilege through access to quality education.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that educational interventions actually lead to improved learning outcomes and long-term economic mobility for students.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The massive scale of educational need in Pakistan provides significant room for additional funding to build new schools and expand scholarships.

strengths.detail: The organization directs a remarkable <cite id="3">89.5% of its budget to program expenses</cite>, significantly outperforming the peer median.
TCF USA operates with high fundraising efficiency, spending only <cite id="4">$0.10 per $1 raised</cite>.
The charity maintains a <cite id="5">99.33333333333333/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting excellent accountability and financial health.

strengths_deep_dive: The Citizens Foundation USA distinguishes itself through exceptional financial efficiency and institutional credibility. With a <cite id="3">89.5% program expense ratio</cite>, the organization ensures that donor funds are maximized for direct educational impact in Pakistan. This efficiency is further highlighted by its fundraising metrics, costing just <cite id="4">$0.10 per $1 raised</cite>. External validators confirm this strong performance, awarding the charity a <cite id="5">99.99.33333333333333/100 from Charity Navigator score</cite> and a Platinum Seal from Candid, signaling top-tier transparency and governance.
rich_narrative.summary: The Citizens Foundation USA (TCF USA), founded in <cite id="1">1995</cite>, is a prominent educational nonprofit dedicated to supporting civil society in Pakistan by providing quality education to underprivileged children. The organization operates at a significant scale, reporting <cite id="2">$18,303,365 in total revenue</cite> for the recent fiscal year. TCF USA is highly efficient, maintaining an exceptional <cite id="3">89.5% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that nearly all contributions directly fund educational initiatives such as school construction and operational support. The charity demonstrates remarkable fundraising efficiency, spending just <cite id="4">$0.10 per $1 raised</cite>. Donors can give with confidence, as the organization has earned a near-perfect <cite id="5">99.33333333333333/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and holds a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid. Furthermore, TCF USA is <cite id="6">Zakat-eligible</cite>, allowing Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting critical educational infrastructure across Pakistan, including regions like Sindh, Punjab, Balochistan, KPK, and AJK. In recent years, the organization has supported <cite id="7">534 schools</cite> and facilitated numerous higher education scholarships, demonstrating a sustained commitment to long-term community empowerment.
